italic.text: A mission undertaken to obtain information by visual observation, or other detection methods, about the activities and resources of an enemy, or about the meteorological, hydrographic, or geographic characteristics of a particular area.

line.text: In Sword, to reach a set of ordered terrain objectives in order to search for specific objects (such as mines and various obstacles) by activating a specific "reconnaissance" action. Agents of the simulation are able to reconnoiter objects, specific locations and urban blocks. The time required for reconnaissance depends on the type of the objective to reconnoiter. The bigger the objective, the longer the reconnaissance takes.

The agent moves toward each of the objectives following the order of the elements in the list. If one of them is not reachable (an urban block inside which the agent cannot move, for instance), the agent moves as close as possible, otherwise it moves to the center of the position. Average speed depends on the physical capabilities and takes into account terrain properties.

Upon reaching an objective, the agent starts the reconnaissance (the report "Position reconnaissance started" should be displayed). After a delay depending on the size of the objective, the reconnaissance ends (the report "Position reconnaissance completed" should be displayed), and the agent starts to move to the next objective.
Once all the objectives have been reconnoitered, the agent stays at its last position.
